## Government Tender Announcement: ITT - Water Supply Upgrades - Digby Ferry Terminal

### Project Overview
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of Transport Canada invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the ITT - Water Supply Upgrades - Digby Ferry Terminal project. The project involves upgrading the existing water supply system at the Digby Ferry Terminal, which includes demolishing the existing system and replacing it with a new potable water system.

### Project Requirements
The upgrade work includes:

* Drilling a new well
* Installing a new water treatment system
* Laying new water lines
* Work must be completed by 31 March, 2024

### Pre-qualification Process
To participate in this project, you must have pre-qualified under the Invitation to Qualify process, which was published on CanadaBuys.

### Site Visit
A site visit will be scheduled, and details will be provided to pre-qualified firms via SAP Ariba.

### Enquiries and Proposals
All enquiries and proposal submissions must be made via SAP Ariba. Please note that all enquiries must be received no less than five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time for a response.

### Important Dates
* Tender Close: 14:00 on 20 July 2023
* Contract Start Date: 10 July 2023
* Estimated Project Cost: between $1,000,001 to $5,000,000

### Contracting Authority
The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), Atlantic Region Acquisitions, 1713 Bedford Row, Halifax, N.S., B3J 1T3. Although services are primarily offered in English, both official languages of Canada are accepted for proposal submissions.

### Contact Information
For any queries or clarification, please contact:
Rachel Miller (SPAC/PSPC)
rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
